intro: Taraxacum polyschistum, commonly known as the mountain dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine soils, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are basal, rosette-shaped, and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. The plant is known for its ability to tolerate harsh conditions and is often found in meadows and grasslands at high altitudes.
